title: Short-term intensive course on mathematics instructional design for transitioning to online classes: Strategies for calculations, formulas, graphs, and proof-based problem solving

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematics knowledge (algebra, geometry, statistics, probability) and proficiency in using online learning tools, simple formula editing skills, and foundational graph interpretation
context.additional_context: A mobile-based short-term intensive course for novice professionals in medical, legal, and technical fields to strengthen their capacity for transitioning to online classes. Focuses on practical math education centered on data analysis, probability calculations, graph interpretation, and proof structure design. Aims to improve learners' calculation accuracy and logical reasoning abilities.

learning_goals: Learners can design three or more instructional strategies (simulations, interactive graphs, step-by-step problem-solving and proof visualization) to effectively convey mathematical concepts (e.g., equations, functions, statistics, probability) in online learning environments
Learners can produce and apply two or more mobile-based microlearning materials (calculation practice apps, formula application videos, graph generation tools) to practical tasks

Within one week, learners revise statistical analysis and probability modeling project-based assessments by incorporating two or more peer feedbacks, and achieve 'excellent' ratings in four out of five rubric criteria (problem-solving, graph interpretation, formula application, data analysis, proof structure)
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
